Melanocytic nevi.description: Commonly known as moles, these are usually benign growths on the skin caused by clusters of pigmented cells.
precautions: Use sunscreen with SPF 30 or higher
Monitor for changes in shape, size, or color

Melanoma.description: A serious and aggressive form of skin cancer that develops in the cells that produce melanin.
precautions: Wear protective clothing in the sun

Benign keratosis-like lesions.description: Non-cancerous skin growths that often appear as rough, scaly patches.

Basal cell carcinoma.description: A common type of skin cancer that grows slowly and is unlikely to spread.
precautions: Seek early medical consultation if unusual growths appear

Actinic keratoses.description: Rough, scaly patches on the skin caused by years of sun exposure, often considered precancerous.

Vascular lesions.description: Abnormal blood vessels that appear as red or purple marks on the skin.
precautions: Consider laser treatments for cosmetic concerns

Dermatofibroma.description: A common benign skin nodule that often appears as a firm bump, usually harmless.
precautions: Monitor for growth or change in color
Seek medical advice if pain or irritation occurs
